answers.answer: Should also mention I've been having other symptoms of preeclamsia, but they could be related to other things such as nausea, and dizziness.

Did they do blood work?  Are they collecting a 24 hour urine from you?Many women can have elevated blood pressures, yet not have pre-eclampsia.  Let me know what your doctor says to you.Usually, if a woman has elevated blood pressures as you described, she would be observed for a while in L&D, blood would be taken for certain tests, and often a collection of 24 hours worth of urine would be done to test for protein.Rest on your side as much as you can.  Be watchful for swelling, particularly of the face and hands.  Report headaches, blurred vision, or other symptoms that are worrisome.

ditto on everything peek said.we discovered i had preeclampsia at 35 weeks. By the time they did all the tests and got the results, i was 36 weeks. My doctor had me go straight to the hospital to have a c-sec when he got the results of my blood and 24 hr urine collection.i did have a lot of swelling prior to then, but it was summer so most preggos are swollen. It did get REALLY bad in the last few days. Honestly, i didn't have any other very obvious symptoms. While waiting for the results, i did start to feel sick (tests were done on Fri, so i went all weekend not knowing). By Monday i was feeling really sick. can't say exactly how though... they say "malaise" is a symptom, and that's exactly how i'd describe it. But extreme malaise. in addition to the blood tests which showed liver function and the 24 hr urine specimen, my OB did ultrasounds. The u/s showed that the placenta was calcifying, so the baby was not getting the nutrition it needed.for some reason, my doctor didn't consider my BP readings while i was sitting to be accurate. Anytime i had a high BP reading, he had me lay on my left side while they rechecked it. It was always lower on my left side. Try your best to relax and lay on your left side until your appointment tomorrow. Expect them to draw blood and test your urine. If they find protein in your urine, you may be asked to do a 24 hour collection to determine how much protein is spilling in to your urine. By the time i had my c-section, i was +4, (which as far as i understand is as high as it goes??). I would also ask for an ultrasound to check on the baby, if possible.let us know how it goes. How far along are you?

The labor and delivery here did no blood work and didnt tell me my urine results and it wasnt a 24hr urine.Probably because they arent my doctors so I guess they dont care all much ya know.  It's the one on the military base whose doctors wont even see me because of my high risk situation, but  L&D can't turn someone away.I go to my doctor tomorrow, and I am having a growth scan so I'm sure they will look at everything ya know.I'm 24weeks 3 days now.I've read some of the symptoms of preeclamsia, and high BP.The only things that have changed in the past couple days is nausea and dizziness. I've developed both. I think the highest I had today was like 138/91. So I don't know. We will see tomorrow though. Thanks for the replies.
Also wanted to say I cant tell if the swelling in my face is from this or my high levels of steroids right now. :(

DKL, please take your blood pressure a couple times a day, after resting for about 5 min and record them for your doctors visits.If your normal is 100/60, 138/91 at home while resting is of concern.Steroids can elevate your BP somewhat, though.  And can cause some swelling.  So if you are on high doses of steroids right now, both symptoms could be from that.Its not good to simply drop in to an L&D unless you feel you have a life threatening emergency.  They will simply make sure you aren't in imminent danger and send you home to follow up with your own doc.  Did your doc tell you to go to L&D?  If so, then he should have called ahead with orders.If you think something is happening that is of concern, you should call your doctors office and ask what to do.  If its after hours, call the office # and you will get the answering service.  If the doc feels you should go to L&D, he'll tell you.  You will get either your own doc, or whoever is covering for him/her.Sounds like they just checked a random urine, and there must not have been protein in it.  Which is good, but not 100% diagnostic.  The steroids could be temporarily driving up your BP and causing you to retain water.

They discovered I had preeclamsia at about 33 weeks. They took my bp and collected urine as usual. I was put on bedrest and then induced at 38 weeks. Also, I had to constantly pee in a jug and take it to the hospital lab. It was awful. Best of luck to you!
That day I called my nurse and one of the residents told me to go into l&d. So I did what i was told.
did you make it to the doctor today? what happened?

I have developed preeclamsia at 32 weeks of pregnancy, my BP was 160-10 or simetimes higher. I was in hospital for one month, they treat me with adalat and aldoment (medication against hypertension) in the first preg i had bl 80-50, but i miscarry at 4 months. Second pregnancy was sucesfull, but i suffer ppreeclamsia, ang my son, was delivered at 35 weeks, through cesarian. Everything went fine for both of us. I heared so many stories at the time, and i was scarry to death. Dont worry. Dring a lot of fluids, use lemons (because bring your high bp down) and relax. In the hospital where i staid (in italy, cause i was in vacation) there were hundred of women with precamsia and everything went ok for all of them. the only cure of preeeclam is delivery. Now that my son is 4 month old my bp is back to normal. Goog luck

question: For those who have had Preeclamsia Could you please tell me your experiences such asHow high was your BP?When in your pregnancy did you develop it?How did they treat it?Did you have all the symptoms? If not which ones did you have?Did you always have swelling?My story is I went into L & D yesterday, cause I was told to due to high BP. When I got there my BP was 169/88. They got my BP to go down and apparently I was dehydrated so I got some fluids too. I was told the rest of my pregnancy will be like this and pretty much to rest. Since it was not my doctor they didn't diagnose me with anything. They just told me to make sure I keep my doc apt tomorrow.  On a side note all through this pregnancy and my first pregnancy my BP stayed at 100/60.Anyones experiences with either Preeclamsia or just gestational hypertention I'd love to hear. This is new for me as I didn't experience this with my first DD. A little scary.... I've never been on bedrest or anything.... I'm kinda at a loss here.
title: Preeclamsia vs. Gestational Hypertention
